page.title: 16Churches of North-East Mynd
page.content: St. Mary's Church at Leebotwood is an ancient, unrestored church dating from the 13th century. There are many plaques on the inside walls in memory of the Corbett family of nearby Longnor Hall. The altar is kept attractive with flowers, in front of the pretty stained glass window. St. Michael & All Angels Church at Smethcott was re-built in 1850.It is a plain building, but inside the church there are attractive tapestry kneelers and an embroidered altar cloth, all made by members of the congregation. St. Michael & All Angels Church at Woolstaston was first mentioned in 1272 and restored in 1864.It is a stone church with a black & white porch and Gothic doors with an iron sanctuary knocker.Inside, there is an altar rail,altar chairs,lectern and pulpit,all carved by a local carver.
